intro: Senecio gomereus, commonly known as the Gomera groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio gomereus is often found in open habitats, contributing to the unique flora of its native region.
